newsArray.title: England fans fume after BBC commentary 'ruins' Ella Toone's stunner vs Australia
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Dan Marsh)
newsArray.description: England fans have complained on X about the BBC after the live match commentary spoiled the outcome of Ella Toone's goal in the World Cup semi-final against Australia
newsArray.content: Fans have taken to social media in anger after BBC's commentary feed appeared to spoil Ella Toone's goal in England's World Cup semi-final against Australia . Toone broke the deadlock in style for the Lionesses against the host nation to leave Sarina Wiegman's side on the cusp of securing a place in Sunday's final against Spain. But the golden moment was 'ruined' for some fans due to the fact that lead commentator Robin Cowen's voice seemed to be out of sync with the live action. An unimpressed fan pointed it out on X, posting: "Have the BBC realised the commentary and sound is in front of the video? Ruined the Toone goal." England 1-0 Australia LIVE: Lionesses take World Cup semi-final lead thanks to Toone stunner Ella Toone's touching goal celebration as England star's gesture noticed vs Australia Others flocked to various social media apps to vent their frustrations during the half-time interval of Wednesday's big match, at which point England led the game 1-0. Another posted: "Annoying that the commentary is ahead of the visual. Goal was announced before we saw it!!!" Fan complaints over the BBC's commentary feed comes just 24 hours after the broadcaster suffered an embarrassing gaffe during Spain's semi-final clash against Sweden, where images of the Lionesses were shown instead of Spain during the preview of the line-ups. There were also complaints over the quality of the live match feed during the game, which Spain eventually won 2-1 following a flurry of late goals. Join the debate! Who do you think will win the Women's World Cup? Let us know here. Toone celebrates after breaking the deadlock in the World Cup semi-final ( Image: Daniela Porcelli/Eurasia Sport Images) Jorge Vilda's side await in Sydney for whomever comes out on top between the Lionesses and Australia. Toone's opener was cancelled out by a thunderbolt from Sam Kerr on the hour mark to leave England's hopes in the balance. However, while Kerr's stunning solo strike may have roused the 75,000 capacity crowd in attendance at Stadium Austrlia, Lauren Hemp quickly restored England's advantage in the 71st minute with a cool finish following a raking ball forward from skipper Millie Bright. England headed into the tournament as one of the favourites for glory after winning the European Championships last summer. The Lionesses have never reached the final of the World Cup in their history. Join our new WhatsApp community! Click this link to receive your daily dose of Mirror Football content. We also treat our community members to special offers, promotions, and adverts from us and our partners. If you don’t like our community, you can check out any time you like. If you’re curious, you can read our Privacy Notice.

newsArray.title: Newcastle set to host two Saudi Arabia international fixtures at St James' Park
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Tom Victor)
newsArray.description: Newcastle United came under Saudi ownership midway through the 2021-22 season, and will how host games played by the country's national team at their home ground
newsArray.content: Saudi Arabia will play two of their Asian Cup warm-up games at St James' Park, Newcastle United have confirmed. Aa consortium backed by Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund took over the Magpies in 2021 , with the club qualifying for the Champions League in their first full season under the new owners. However, these are the first international games to be held at St James' Park since the takeover. The games in question, in the September international break, will see the Saudi team take on Costa Rica and South Korea. They qualified unbeaten for the Asian Cup, which will be held in January and February in Qatar , and have been drawn in a group with Thailand, Kyrgyzstan and Oman. Tickets for the games have been priced at £5 for adults and £3 for concessions. The Costa Rica game will be held on September 8, with South Korea's visit coming four days later. Eight key takeaways from Prime Video's We are Newcastle United documentary Eddie Howe's expletive-laden dressing room rant as Newcastle chief sends warning to rivals Newcastle's stadium is no stranger to international football, but more than a decade has passed since it last held such a fixture. That was during the 2012 Olympic Games, when it held six games including Brazil's quarter-final win against Honduras. St James' Park was also one of the stadiums in use for Euro 96, and was the venue for three England games in the early 2000s when Wembley was being rebuilt. The last of those was a World Cup qualifying victory over Azerbaijan in 2005, with Steven Gerrard and David Beckham on target. The games will be Saudi Arabia's first in Europe since September 2022, when they played a number of fixtures in Spain. The last of those, a friendly against the United States, ended goalless. Will you be going to the games? Have your say in the comments section Watch 'We Are Newcastle United' How you can watch the new documentary 'We Are Newcastle United' Narrated by Newcastle United’s all-time leading goalscorer Alan Shearer, the series will offer a unique insight into the club’s ongoing evolution under head coach Eddie Howe, offering exclusive access to the club’s decision makers and following the Magpies’ ongoing 2022/23 season from close quarters. Free with trial Amazon Get it now The upcoming matches will be the Saudi Arabia's first since a pair of defeats against Bolivia and Venezuela in Jeddah in March. Those, in turn, were the Green Falcons' first against non-Asian opposition since the World Cup in Qatar. With Herve Renard at the helm, they beat eventual champions Argentina in their opener before losing to Poland and Mexico. Renard has since left his post, with under-23 coach Saad Al-Shehri taking interim charge of the senior side.

newsArray.title: Ella Toone's touching goal celebration as England star's gesture noticed vs Australia
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Hannah Pinnock)
newsArray.description: England took the lead in their World Cup semi-final clash against Australia on Wednesday as Ella Toone fired them in front in the first half
newsArray.content: Ella Toone pre-planned her goal celebration that followed her stunning World Cup semi-final strike against Australia . The Lionesses took the lead against the Matildas at Stadium Australia in the first half. Some patient play ended with the Manchester United star picking up the ball in space in the box and driving it into the top corner. "What a pure strike from Toone and great creativity from Russo, who fights and fights to create something from nothing," said Karen Bardsley on commentary for BBC Radio 5 Live. "She set it up for Ella Toone to absolutely wallop it into the top corner." As celebrations ensued on the pitch, Toone kissed her wrist and displayed a heart with her hands. It's a gesture she already had planned going into the tournament. Why are Australia Women's football team called The Matildas? Truth behind the nickname Beth Mead opens up on Women's World Cup regrets after England semi-final heartbreak Speaking to BBC Radio 5 Live before the World Cup, she 23-year-old shared how she would celebrate if she scored. "In tournament football moments fall to different people and it's if you take those moments," she said. "We've definitely had a lot of them throughout the tournament. "I'm sure if it falls to me in the box then I'd be buzzing if I put it away. Usually (with celebrations) anything happens. "But, I'm on strict orders from my mates. We all got a matching tattoo before I came out (to Australia). They want me to kiss it and do a little love heart. I promised them I'd do that." Ella Toone of England scores her team's first goal in the semi-finals ( Image: Brendon Thorne) Ella Toone was on target for England against Australia It's Toone's first goal at this summer's World Cup with Georgia Stanway, Lauren James , Lauren Hemp, Alessia Russo, Rachel Daly and Chloe Kelly among the goalscorers so far. But, the United star isn't unfamiliar with scoring important goals on the big stage as she opened the scoring against Germany in the Euros final last year. The winners of England vs Australia will take on Spain the final on Sunday, with the loser to face Sweden in the third-place play-off on Saturday. England Women's Team 2023 home shirt Get the England 2023 home shirt here Show your support for The L ionesses throughout the FIFA Women's World Cup with the latest England home shirt. Mixing the classic with the contemporary, this shirt is being worn by the team as they bid to add a World Cup to their incredible European Championship triumph in 2022. £79.95 Nike Buy it now

newsArray.title: Football : l'Agenais Aymeric Laporte futur coéquipier de Cristiano Ronaldo ? Le défenseur pourrait rejoindre l'Arabie saoudite et le club d'Al Nassr
newsArray.description: Très actif depuis le début de la période de transferts, le club saoudien d'Al Nassr serait en discussion pour s'attacher les services du Lot-et-Garonnais Aymeric Laporte, défenseur central de Manchester City.
newsArray.content: Très actif depuis le début de la période de transferts, le club saoudien d'Al Nassr serait en discussion pour s'attacher les services du Lot-et-Garonnais Aymeric Laporte, défenseur central de Manchester City. L'Agenais Aymeric Laporte sur le point de rejoindre (lui aussi) l'Arabie saoudite ? Selon plusieurs médias anglais, le défenseur de Manchester City serait sur les tablettes du club d'Al Nassr, club qui aurait déjà formulé une offre auprès de l'écurie qui a récemment remporté la Ligue des champions. D'après les informations rapportées, Manchester City aurait déjà accepté la proposition du club saoudien, tandis que l'ancien joueur du SU Agen serait ouvert à toute possibilité. \ud83d\udea8 Manchester City accept offer from Al Nassr for Aymeric Laporte. 29yo Spain centre-back into final 2 years of contract + thought to be open to possibility. willing to sell, with Saudi Pro League club pushing to get deal done Transféré dans le club de Manchester à l'été 2018, celui qui a décidé de représenter la sélection espagnole (22 sélections) sort d'une saison contrastée avec les Cityzens, d'abord éloigné des terrains pour une blessure au genou, peu utilisé par la suite (12 matchs), mais vainqueur de la Ligue des champions. Le club d'Al Nassr serait alors décidé renforcer son effectif et à s'offrir le joueur de 29 ans à deux ans de la fin de son contrat. Estimé à 25 millions d'euros par le site spécialisé , Le Lot-et-Garonnais rejoindrait ainsi un effectif composé de nombreuses stars comme Cristiano Ronaldo, Sadio Mané, Marcelo Brozovic, Seko Fofana, Alex Telles ou encore Anderson Talisca.

newsArray.title: Tottenham Hotspur chasing Arsenal wonderkid in era-defining deal between both clubs: report
newsArray.description: Tottenham Hotspur and Arsenal just don't do business – but Spurs would like to take a Gunners asset with their rivals eager to sell
newsArray.content: Tottenham Hotspur want an Arsenal wonderkid, in a deal that would would shock the Premier League. The two north London sides have one of the fiercest rivalries in English football and haven't done business with one another in a very long time. The last player to move directly from one side to the other was Sol Campbell – but that was at the expiry of his contract, with having no say in the matter. Yet may actually consider selling an asset to their bitterest foes, as they look to raise capital in the final throws of the transfer window. have made the extraordinary claim that Spurs would like to take young Gunners goal machine Folarin Balogun down the Seven Sisters Road, as sporting director Edu struggles to find a buyer willing to match the 22-year-old's £50 million valuation. Tottenham certainly have the money for such a deal, given that they've just sold another player who began his career in Arsenal's Hale End academy, Harry Kane, for around €100m. But as unlikely as a deal may seem, there may be a couple of reasons why the Gunners may bite. Arsenal may not see Tottenham as a serious rival for the title anymore, having finished last season six places and 24 points ahead of them last term before strengthening in the same window that Spurs have lost Kane. can obviously meet the valuation – and Arsenal could even be in a position to charge a little more, as a kind of "rivals tax". Despite the reasons that a sale across north London could make sense in some respects, however, such a move right now feels unfathomable. The two rivals never conduct business with one another and despite Arsenal's willingness to offload Balogun, they would certainly not like to see such a talented player with huge potential heading to a club who will surely rival them in the coming years if not now. There are believed to be other suitors for Balogun, including and . Arsenal could well insert a buy-back clause in any deal that sees the United States international depart the Emirates Stadium. Balogun is valued at €30m by .

newsArray.title: What time and TV channel is Derry v Tobol in Conference League qualifier? Streaming information and betting odds
creator: news@irishmirror.ie (Michael Turnbull)
newsArray.description: The Candystripes will edge closer to European group stage football if they can overturn a 1-0 defecit.
newsArray.content: Derry City must overcome a 1-0 first leg defeat to Tobol if they are to have any hopes of qualifying for the Conference League group stage. The Candystripes were narrowly beaten by a wondergoal from Tobol defender Roman Arsankulov but will fancy their chances ahead of the second-leg in Tallaght. Derry's own Ryan McBride Brandywell Stadium doesn't meet UEFA requirements and so the Dublin venue will be the location for the all-important tie. But this is seen as a positive as the playing surface and size of the pitch in Tallaght will likely favour the free-flowing, attacking football that Ruaidhri Higgins has instilled into his side. READ MORE : Evan Ferguson last weekend achieved what only 19 other Irishmen managed in Premier League history Nothing less than a two-goal win will keep Derry City's European hopes alive. Here is everything you need to know. Where and when is it? Tallaght Stadium, Dublin on Thursday 17th August. When is kick-off? Kick-off is at 7:45pm. What channel is it on? The match is being shown live on RTE2 from 7:30pm. Can I stream the game? The match can be streamed on the RTE Player. Betting odds Derry City 4/5 Draw 12/5 Tobol 14/5

newsArray.title: Man Utd chief explains Mason Greenwood investigation after delaying return decision
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Tom Blow)
newsArray.description: Manchester United are expected to make a decision on Mason Greenwood's future before the end of the month - with just over two weeks remaining in the transfer window
newsArray.content: Manchester United's chief operating officer has confirmed the club "now just need to make a decision" on Mason Greenwood's future. Greenwood, 21, hasn't played for United since he was arrested in January 2022. Charges of attempted rape, engaging in controlling and coercive behaviour, and assault occasioning actual bodily harm were dropped by the Crown Prosecution Service (CPS) in February. United started conducting an internal investigation into the incident after Greenwood's criminal charges were dropped but are yet to make a decision on his future. The England forward still has two years left on his contract, with a club option of a further 12 months. United were initially expected to announce a decision on Greenwood's future ahead of the new Premier League season, but that has been delayed. The club's chief executive officer Richard Arnold will make the call, but he will still need co-chair Joel Glazer to sign it off. Man Utd staff hold FFP meeting as West Ham concerned over Harry Maguire transfer Man Utd fans protest against Mason Greenwood return as Glazers also targeted United's chief operating officer Collette Roche was asked by The Athletic to give an update on Greenwood's return. "We've done a really detailed and thorough internal investigation and we've asked as many people as we can around what happened and try to understand it beyond the original investigation done by the police," said Roche. "You'd expect us to engage with people who were relevant in terms of stakeholder groups. And now we just need to make the decision. That decision is firmly a decision that's on us." United's head of fan engagement Rick McGagh added: "It's not accurate to say we've had full consultation with the fan advisory board on what decision we're making. This is not a consultation." Greenwood hasn't played professional football for 20 months ( Image: Getty Images) Many fans don't want to see Greenwood represent their club due to the severity of the allegations. A protest against his return was staged outside of Old Trafford ahead of United's 1-0 Premier League victory against Wolves on Monday night. United's fan advisory board and women's team have been consulted, but the decision rests with Arnold. Several members of the women's team have been targeted on social media after reports of their involvement in the decision emerged. Reporters asked Erik ten Hag for his opinion on the matter during United's pre-season tour of the United States. The Dutchman said: "Of course, I have said my ideas and opinions but it's a club decision. We all have to accept that. I can't say so much about it, but what I say is I shared my opinion about it, so let's see what’s going to happen and what the decision will be." Join our new WhatsApp community! newsArray.title: Transferts : Metz veut le défenseur suédois Johan Bangsbo
creator: Cyril Olives-Berthet
newsArray.description: Le défenseur Johan Bangsbo (Göteborg) est courtisé par Metz, qui a déjà proposé une offre au club suédois.
newsArray.content: À la recherche d'un défenseur central, Metz a jeté son dévolu sur Johan Bangsbo. Le Suédois de 20 ans, sous contrat jusqu'en 2025 avec Göteborg, et récemment nommé pour le trophée Golden Boy, a fait l'objet d'une première offre messine, selon une information d'Expressen, que nous pouvons confirmer. L'international Espoirs, titulaire depuis le début de la saison, n'a pas participé au match de dimanche dernier, face à Djurgarden (4-1).

newsArray.title: Man Utd transfer decision made as Erik ten Hag outcast denied huge move
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Dan Marsh)
newsArray.description: Manchester United defender Eric Bailly is surplus to requirements at Old Trafford and linked with Al-Nassr, but the Saudi outfit are now poised to sign Aymeric Laporte
newsArray.content: Eric Bailly has been left in limbo following reports that Manchester City have accepted a bid from Al-Nassr for Aymeric Laporte. Bailly, 29, is surplus to requirements at Manchester United and spent the whole of the 2022/23 campaign on loan in France with Marseille, but he failed to do enough to persuade the Ligue 1 outfit to make the move permanent. The Ivory Coast international is free to leave Old Trafford for good this summer and was seemingly lined up to be the next high-profile star to join the Saudi Pro League - but that move has now been scuppered by Al-Nassr's interest in Laporte. Man Utd transfer news LIVE: Maguire deal collapses, Amrabat bid 'imminent', Glazers set to sell Gary Neville makes fresh Man Utd transfer demand after Sofyan Amrabat endorsement According to The Athletic, the Saudi outfit have had a bid accepted for the 29-year-old centre-back, who featured just 12 times for the champions last season. Furthermore, Laporte is believed to be open to the idea of moving to the Middle East, indicating that a deal is viable. Al-Nassr's move for Laporte is likely to have significant ramifications for Bailly, who had been touted as a potential signing for the club who acquired Cristiano Ronaldo back in December. Sky Sports have since claimed that the defender will now consider his options after declining the opportunity to discuss a move to Besiktas, who had shown an interest in acquiring him. Join the debate! Where do you think Bailly will be playing next season? Let us know here. Bailly spent last season on loan at Marseille and is surplus to requirements at Old Trafford ( Image: Jonathan Moscrop/Getty Images) The defender was not a part of the Manchester United squad which travelled to the United States on their pre-season tour after his season-long stint at Marseille was wrecked by injuries. Bailly managed just 17 appearances for the French giants and struggled to show the sort of form which convinced United to shell out a whopping £30million for his services back in 2016 during the early days of Jose Mourinho's Old Trafford reign. Bailly's current plight was met with sympathy by his old international manager, Patrick Beaumelle - but the former Ivory Coast boss admitted that the defender's career was effectively in tatters. Manchester United home shirt 2023/2024 Get the United home shirt for 23/34 United's Adidas home shirt is made up of the same colour of the city's iconic red rose and features a black collar. The collar also features a dash of both red and white, giving it a slick and modernised look. Prices start from £55 Kitbag Buy it now "It's a mess. He remains and will remain one of the best defenders I have known," Beaumelle told Africa Foot United last season. "It's a shame because a 100 per cent Bailly could have helped the team to grab points to be second. "He has not always been 100 per cent, it is perhaps the fault of bad luck when he loved Marseille and would have appreciated being part of this project." Join our new WhatsApp community! newsArray.title: Après Leandro Paredes, Renato Sanches (PSG) rejoint officiellement l'AS Rome
creator: Julien Baudot
newsArray.description: Quelques minutes après l'officialisation du transfert de Leandro Paredes du PSG à l'AS Rome, le club italien a annoncé, ce mercredi, l'arrivée du milieu portugais Renato Sanches, dans le cadre d'un prêt avec option d'achat obligatoire de 15 M€ en fonction du nombre de matches joués.
newsArray.content: , l'AS Rome a officialisé, ce mercredi, le transfert d'un autre milieu international en provenance du PSG, Renato Sanches. Le Portugais n'entrait plus dans les plans de l'entraîneur espagnol Luis Enrique. Selon nos informations, l'ex-Lillois arrive dans la capitale italienne dans le cadre d'un prêt avec option d'achat obligatoire de 15 M€ en fonction d'un certain nombre de matches joués. Surpuissant et capable de casser plusieurs lignes de pression par la passe et le dribble, Renato Sanches n'aura jamais réussi à s'imposer dans l'effectif parisien, en raison de ses blessures musculaires à répétition. Sous les ordres de José Mourinho, son compatriote, l'ex-Bavarois pourrait retrouver de la continuité, lui qui a réalisé une saison 2020-2021 excellente.

newsArray.description: Très actif depuis le début de la période de transferts, le club saoudien d'Al Nassr serait en discussion pour s'attacher les services du Lot-et-Garonnais Aymeric Laporte, défenseur central de Manchester City.
newsArray.content: Très actif depuis le début de la période de transferts, le club saoudien d'Al Nassr serait en discussion pour s'attacher les services du Lot-et-Garonnais Aymeric Laporte, défenseur central de Manchester City. L'Agenais Aymeric Laporte sur le point de rejoindre (lui aussi) l'Arabie saoudite ? Selon plusieurs médias anglais, le défenseur de Manchester City serait sur les tablettes du club d'Al Nassr, club qui aurait déjà formulé une offre auprès de l'écurie qui a récemment remporté la Ligue des champions. D'après les informations rapportées, Manchester City aurait déjà accepté la proposition du club saoudien, tandis que l'ancien joueur du SU Agen serait ouvert à toute possibilité. \ud83d\udea8 Manchester City accept offer from Al Nassr for Aymeric Laporte. 29yo Spain centre-back into final 2 years of contract + thought to be open to possibility. willing to sell, with Saudi Pro League club pushing to get deal done Transféré dans le club de Manchester à l'été 2018, celui qui a décidé de représenter la sélection espagnole (22 sélections) sort d'une saison contrastée avec les Cityzens, d'abord éloigné des terrains pour une blessure au genou, peu utilisé par la suite (12 matchs), mais vainqueur de la Ligue des champions. Le club d'Al Nassr serait alors décidé renforcer son effectif et à s'offrir le joueur de 29 ans à deux ans de la fin de son contrat. Estimé à 25 millions d'euros par le site spécialisé , Le Lot-et-Garonnais rejoindrait ainsi un effectif composé de nombreuses stars comme Cristiano Ronaldo, Sadio Mané, Marcelo Brozovic, Seko Fofana, Alex Telles ou encore Anderson Talisca.

newsArray.title: Tottenham Hotspur chasing Arsenal wonderkid in era-defining deal between both clubs: report
newsArray.description: Tottenham Hotspur and Arsenal just don't do business – but Spurs would like to take a Gunners asset with their rivals eager to sell
newsArray.content: Tottenham Hotspur want an Arsenal wonderkid, in a deal that would would shock the Premier League. The two north London sides have one of the fiercest rivalries in English football and haven't done business with one another in a very long time. The last player to move directly from one side to the other was Sol Campbell – but that was at the expiry of his contract, with having no say in the matter. Yet may actually consider selling an asset to their bitterest foes, as they look to raise capital in the final throws of the transfer window. have made the extraordinary claim that Spurs would like to take young Gunners goal machine Folarin Balogun down the Seven Sisters Road, as sporting director Edu struggles to find a buyer willing to match the 22-year-old's £50 million valuation. Tottenham certainly have the money for such a deal, given that they've just sold another player who began his career in Arsenal's Hale End academy, Harry Kane, for around €100m. But as unlikely as a deal may seem, there may be a couple of reasons why the Gunners may bite. Arsenal may not see Tottenham as a serious rival for the title anymore, having finished last season six places and 24 points ahead of them last term before strengthening in the same window that Spurs have lost Kane. can obviously meet the valuation – and Arsenal could even be in a position to charge a little more, as a kind of "rivals tax". Despite the reasons that a sale across north London could make sense in some respects, however, such a move right now feels unfathomable. The two rivals never conduct business with one another and despite Arsenal's willingness to offload Balogun, they would certainly not like to see such a talented player with huge potential heading to a club who will surely rival them in the coming years if not now. There are believed to be other suitors for Balogun, including and . Arsenal could well insert a buy-back clause in any deal that sees the United States international depart the Emirates Stadium. Balogun is valued at €30m by .

newsArray.title: What time and TV channel is Derry v Tobol in Conference League qualifier? Streaming information and betting odds
creator: news@irishmirror.ie (Michael Turnbull)
newsArray.description: The Candystripes will edge closer to European group stage football if they can overturn a 1-0 defecit.
newsArray.content: Derry City must overcome a 1-0 first leg defeat to Tobol if they are to have any hopes of qualifying for the Conference League group stage. The Candystripes were narrowly beaten by a wondergoal from Tobol defender Roman Arsankulov but will fancy their chances ahead of the second-leg in Tallaght. Derry's own Ryan McBride Brandywell Stadium doesn't meet UEFA requirements and so the Dublin venue will be the location for the all-important tie. But this is seen as a positive as the playing surface and size of the pitch in Tallaght will likely favour the free-flowing, attacking football that Ruaidhri Higgins has instilled into his side. READ MORE : Evan Ferguson last weekend achieved what only 19 other Irishmen managed in Premier League history Nothing less than a two-goal win will keep Derry City's European hopes alive. Here is everything you need to know. Where and when is it? Tallaght Stadium, Dublin on Thursday 17th August. When is kick-off? Kick-off is at 7:45pm. What channel is it on? The match is being shown live on RTE2 from 7:30pm. Can I stream the game? The match can be streamed on the RTE Player. Betting odds Derry City 4/5 Draw 12/5 Tobol 14/5

newsArray.title: Man Utd chief explains Mason Greenwood investigation after delaying return decision
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Tom Blow)
newsArray.description: Manchester United are expected to make a decision on Mason Greenwood's future before the end of the month - with just over two weeks remaining in the transfer window
newsArray.content: Manchester United's chief operating officer has confirmed the club "now just need to make a decision" on Mason Greenwood's future. Greenwood, 21, hasn't played for United since he was arrested in January 2022. Charges of attempted rape, engaging in controlling and coercive behaviour, and assault occasioning actual bodily harm were dropped by the Crown Prosecution Service (CPS) in February. United started conducting an internal investigation into the incident after Greenwood's criminal charges were dropped but are yet to make a decision on his future. The England forward still has two years left on his contract, with a club option of a further 12 months. United were initially expected to announce a decision on Greenwood's future ahead of the new Premier League season, but that has been delayed. The club's chief executive officer Richard Arnold will make the call, but he will still need co-chair Joel Glazer to sign it off. Man Utd staff hold FFP meeting as West Ham concerned over Harry Maguire transfer Man Utd fans protest against Mason Greenwood return as Glazers also targeted United's chief operating officer Collette Roche was asked by The Athletic to give an update on Greenwood's return. "We've done a really detailed and thorough internal investigation and we've asked as many people as we can around what happened and try to understand it beyond the original investigation done by the police," said Roche. "You'd expect us to engage with people who were relevant in terms of stakeholder groups. And now we just need to make the decision. That decision is firmly a decision that's on us." United's head of fan engagement Rick McGagh added: "It's not accurate to say we've had full consultation with the fan advisory board on what decision we're making. This is not a consultation." Greenwood hasn't played professional football for 20 months ( Image: Getty Images) Many fans don't want to see Greenwood represent their club due to the severity of the allegations. A protest against his return was staged outside of Old Trafford ahead of United's 1-0 Premier League victory against Wolves on Monday night. United's fan advisory board and women's team have been consulted, but the decision rests with Arnold. Several members of the women's team have been targeted on social media after reports of their involvement in the decision emerged. Reporters asked Erik ten Hag for his opinion on the matter during United's pre-season tour of the United States. The Dutchman said: "Of course, I have said my ideas and opinions but it's a club decision. We all have to accept that. I can't say so much about it, but what I say is I shared my opinion about it, so let's see what’s going to happen and what the decision will be." Join our new WhatsApp community! newsArray.title: Transferts : Metz veut le défenseur suédois Johan Bangsbo
creator: Cyril Olives-Berthet
newsArray.description: Le défenseur Johan Bangsbo (Göteborg) est courtisé par Metz, qui a déjà proposé une offre au club suédois.
newsArray.content: À la recherche d'un défenseur central, Metz a jeté son dévolu sur Johan Bangsbo. Le Suédois de 20 ans, sous contrat jusqu'en 2025 avec Göteborg, et récemment nommé pour le trophée Golden Boy, a fait l'objet d'une première offre messine, selon une information d'Expressen, que nous pouvons confirmer. L'international Espoirs, titulaire depuis le début de la saison, n'a pas participé au match de dimanche dernier, face à Djurgarden (4-1).

newsArray.title: Man Utd transfer decision made as Erik ten Hag outcast denied huge move
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Dan Marsh)
newsArray.description: Manchester United defender Eric Bailly is surplus to requirements at Old Trafford and linked with Al-Nassr, but the Saudi outfit are now poised to sign Aymeric Laporte
newsArray.content: Eric Bailly has been left in limbo following reports that Manchester City have accepted a bid from Al-Nassr for Aymeric Laporte. Bailly, 29, is surplus to requirements at Manchester United and spent the whole of the 2022/23 campaign on loan in France with Marseille, but he failed to do enough to persuade the Ligue 1 outfit to make the move permanent. The Ivory Coast international is free to leave Old Trafford for good this summer and was seemingly lined up to be the next high-profile star to join the Saudi Pro League - but that move has now been scuppered by Al-Nassr's interest in Laporte. Man Utd transfer news LIVE: Maguire deal collapses, Amrabat bid 'imminent', Glazers set to sell Gary Neville makes fresh Man Utd transfer demand after Sofyan Amrabat endorsement According to The Athletic, the Saudi outfit have had a bid accepted for the 29-year-old centre-back, who featured just 12 times for the champions last season. Furthermore, Laporte is believed to be open to the idea of moving to the Middle East, indicating that a deal is viable. Al-Nassr's move for Laporte is likely to have significant ramifications for Bailly, who had been touted as a potential signing for the club who acquired Cristiano Ronaldo back in December. Sky Sports have since claimed that the defender will now consider his options after declining the opportunity to discuss a move to Besiktas, who had shown an interest in acquiring him. Join the debate! Where do you think Bailly will be playing next season? Let us know here. Bailly spent last season on loan at Marseille and is surplus to requirements at Old Trafford ( Image: Jonathan Moscrop/Getty Images) The defender was not a part of the Manchester United squad which travelled to the United States on their pre-season tour after his season-long stint at Marseille was wrecked by injuries. Bailly managed just 17 appearances for the French giants and struggled to show the sort of form which convinced United to shell out a whopping £30million for his services back in 2016 during the early days of Jose Mourinho's Old Trafford reign. Bailly's current plight was met with sympathy by his old international manager, Patrick Beaumelle - but the former Ivory Coast boss admitted that the defender's career was effectively in tatters. Manchester United home shirt 2023/2024 Get the United home shirt for 23/34 United's Adidas home shirt is made up of the same colour of the city's iconic red rose and features a black collar. The collar also features a dash of both red and white, giving it a slick and modernised look. Prices start from £55 Kitbag Buy it now "It's a mess. He remains and will remain one of the best defenders I have known," Beaumelle told Africa Foot United last season. "It's a shame because a 100 per cent Bailly could have helped the team to grab points to be second. "He has not always been 100 per cent, it is perhaps the fault of bad luck when he loved Marseille and would have appreciated being part of this project." Join our new WhatsApp community! newsArray.title: Après Leandro Paredes, Renato Sanches (PSG) rejoint officiellement l'AS Rome
creator: Julien Baudot
newsArray.description: Quelques minutes après l'officialisation du transfert de Leandro Paredes du PSG à l'AS Rome, le club italien a annoncé, ce mercredi, l'arrivée du milieu portugais Renato Sanches, dans le cadre d'un prêt avec option d'achat obligatoire de 15 M€ en fonction du nombre de matches joués.
newsArray.content: , l'AS Rome a officialisé, ce mercredi, le transfert d'un autre milieu international en provenance du PSG, Renato Sanches. Le Portugais n'entrait plus dans les plans de l'entraîneur espagnol Luis Enrique. Selon nos informations, l'ex-Lillois arrive dans la capitale italienne dans le cadre d'un prêt avec option d'achat obligatoire de 15 M€ en fonction d'un certain nombre de matches joués. Surpuissant et capable de casser plusieurs lignes de pression par la passe et le dribble, Renato Sanches n'aura jamais réussi à s'imposer dans l'effectif parisien, en raison de ses blessures musculaires à répétition. Sous les ordres de José Mourinho, son compatriote, l'ex-Bavarois pourrait retrouver de la continuité, lui qui a réalisé une saison 2020-2021 excellente.

newsArray.title: England fans fume after BBC commentary 'ruins' Ella Toone's stunner vs Australia
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Dan Marsh)
newsArray.description: England fans have complained on X about the BBC after the live match commentary spoiled the outcome of Ella Toone's goal in the World Cup semi-final against Australia
newsArray.content: Fans have taken to social media in anger after BBC's commentary feed appeared to spoil Ella Toone's goal in England's World Cup semi-final against Australia . Toone broke the deadlock in style for the Lionesses against the host nation to leave Sarina Wiegman's side on the cusp of securing a place in Sunday's final against Spain. But the golden moment was 'ruined' for some fans due to the fact that lead commentator Robin Cowen's voice seemed to be out of sync with the live action. An unimpressed fan pointed it out on X, posting: "Have the BBC realised the commentary and sound is in front of the video? Ruined the Toone goal." England 1-0 Australia LIVE: Lionesses take World Cup semi-final lead thanks to Toone stunner Ella Toone's touching goal celebration as England star's gesture noticed vs Australia Others flocked to various social media apps to vent their frustrations during the half-time interval of Wednesday's big match, at which point England led the game 1-0. Another posted: "Annoying that the commentary is ahead of the visual. Goal was announced before we saw it!!!" Fan complaints over the BBC's commentary feed comes just 24 hours after the broadcaster suffered an embarrassing gaffe during Spain's semi-final clash against Sweden, where images of the Lionesses were shown instead of Spain during the preview of the line-ups. There were also complaints over the quality of the live match feed during the game, which Spain eventually won 2-1 following a flurry of late goals. Join the debate! Who do you think will win the Women's World Cup? Let us know here. Toone celebrates after breaking the deadlock in the World Cup semi-final ( Image: Daniela Porcelli/Eurasia Sport Images) Jorge Vilda's side await in Sydney for whomever comes out on top between the Lionesses and Australia. Toone's opener was cancelled out by a thunderbolt from Sam Kerr on the hour mark to leave England's hopes in the balance. However, while Kerr's stunning solo strike may have roused the 75,000 capacity crowd in attendance at Stadium Austrlia, Lauren Hemp quickly restored England's advantage in the 71st minute with a cool finish following a raking ball forward from skipper Millie Bright. England headed into the tournament as one of the favourites for glory after winning the European Championships last summer. The Lionesses have never reached the final of the World Cup in their history. Join our new WhatsApp community! Click this link to receive your daily dose of Mirror Football content. newsArray.title: Newcastle set to host two Saudi Arabia international fixtures at St James' Park
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Tom Victor)
newsArray.description: Newcastle United came under Saudi ownership midway through the 2021-22 season, and will how host games played by the country's national team at their home ground
newsArray.content: Saudi Arabia will play two of their Asian Cup warm-up games at St James' Park, Newcastle United have confirmed. Aa consortium backed by Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund took over the Magpies in 2021 , with the club qualifying for the Champions League in their first full season under the new owners. However, these are the first international games to be held at St James' Park since the takeover. The games in question, in the September international break, will see the Saudi team take on Costa Rica and South Korea. They qualified unbeaten for the Asian Cup, which will be held in January and February in Qatar , and have been drawn in a group with Thailand, Kyrgyzstan and Oman. Tickets for the games have been priced at £5 for adults and £3 for concessions. The Costa Rica game will be held on September 8, with South Korea's visit coming four days later. Eight key takeaways from Prime Video's We are Newcastle United documentary Eddie Howe's expletive-laden dressing room rant as Newcastle chief sends warning to rivals Newcastle's stadium is no stranger to international football, but more than a decade has passed since it last held such a fixture. That was during the 2012 Olympic Games, when it held six games including Brazil's quarter-final win against Honduras. St James' Park was also one of the stadiums in use for Euro 96, and was the venue for three England games in the early 2000s when Wembley was being rebuilt. The last of those was a World Cup qualifying victory over Azerbaijan in 2005, with Steven Gerrard and David Beckham on target. The games will be Saudi Arabia's first in Europe since September 2022, when they played a number of fixtures in Spain. The last of those, a friendly against the United States, ended goalless. Will you be going to the games? Have your say in the comments section Watch 'We Are Newcastle United' How you can watch the new documentary 'We Are Newcastle United' Narrated by Newcastle United’s all-time leading goalscorer Alan Shearer, the series will offer a unique insight into the club’s ongoing evolution under head coach Eddie Howe, offering exclusive access to the club’s decision makers and following the Magpies’ ongoing 2022/23 season from close quarters. Free with trial Amazon Get it now The upcoming matches will be the Saudi Arabia's first since a pair of defeats against Bolivia and Venezuela in Jeddah in March. Those, in turn, were the Green Falcons' first against non-Asian opposition since the World Cup in Qatar. With Herve Renard at the helm, they beat eventual champions Argentina in their opener before losing to Poland and Mexico. Renard has since left his post, with under-23 coach Saad Al-Shehri taking interim charge of the senior side.

newsArray.title: Ella Toone's touching goal celebration as England star's gesture noticed vs Australia
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Hannah Pinnock)
newsArray.description: England took the lead in their World Cup semi-final clash against Australia on Wednesday as Ella Toone fired them in front in the first half
newsArray.content: Ella Toone pre-planned her goal celebration that followed her stunning World Cup semi-final strike against Australia . The Lionesses took the lead against the Matildas at Stadium Australia in the first half. Some patient play ended with the Manchester United star picking up the ball in space in the box and driving it into the top corner. "What a pure strike from Toone and great creativity from Russo, who fights and fights to create something from nothing," said Karen Bardsley on commentary for BBC Radio 5 Live. "She set it up for Ella Toone to absolutely wallop it into the top corner." As celebrations ensued on the pitch, Toone kissed her wrist and displayed a heart with her hands. It's a gesture she already had planned going into the tournament. Why are Australia Women's football team called The Matildas? Truth behind the nickname Beth Mead opens up on Women's World Cup regrets after England semi-final heartbreak Speaking to BBC Radio 5 Live before the World Cup, she 23-year-old shared how she would celebrate if she scored. "In tournament football moments fall to different people and it's if you take those moments," she said. "We've definitely had a lot of them throughout the tournament. "I'm sure if it falls to me in the box then I'd be buzzing if I put it away. Usually (with celebrations) anything happens. "But, I'm on strict orders from my mates. We all got a matching tattoo before I came out (to Australia). They want me to kiss it and do a little love heart. I promised them I'd do that." Ella Toone of England scores her team's first goal in the semi-finals ( Image: Brendon Thorne) Ella Toone was on target for England against Australia It's Toone's first goal at this summer's World Cup with Georgia Stanway, Lauren James , Lauren Hemp, Alessia Russo, Rachel Daly and Chloe Kelly among the goalscorers so far. But, the United star isn't unfamiliar with scoring important goals on the big stage as she opened the scoring against Germany in the Euros final last year. The winners of England vs Australia will take on Spain the final on Sunday, with the loser to face Sweden in the third-place play-off on Saturday. England Women's Team 2023 home shirt Get the England 2023 home shirt here Show your support for The L ionesses throughout the FIFA Women's World Cup with the latest England home shirt. Mixing the classic with the contemporary, this shirt is being worn by the team as they bid to add a World Cup to their incredible European Championship triumph in 2022. £79.95 Nike Buy it now

The Dutchman said: "Of course, I have said my ideas and opinions but it's a club decision. We all have to accept that. I can't say so much about it, but what I say is I shared my opinion about it, so let's see what’s going to happen and what the decision will be." Join our new WhatsApp community! newsArray.title: Transferts : Metz veut le défenseur suédois Johan Bangsbo
creator: Cyril Olives-Berthet
newsArray.description: Le défenseur Johan Bangsbo (Göteborg) est courtisé par Metz, qui a déjà proposé une offre au club suédois.
newsArray.content: À la recherche d'un défenseur central, Metz a jeté son dévolu sur Johan Bangsbo. Le Suédois de 20 ans, sous contrat jusqu'en 2025 avec Göteborg, et récemment nommé pour le trophée Golden Boy, a fait l'objet d'une première offre messine, selon une information d'Expressen, que nous pouvons confirmer. L'international Espoirs, titulaire depuis le début de la saison, n'a pas participé au match de dimanche dernier, face à Djurgarden (4-1).

newsArray.title: Man Utd transfer decision made as Erik ten Hag outcast denied huge move
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Dan Marsh)
newsArray.description: Manchester United defender Eric Bailly is surplus to requirements at Old Trafford and linked with Al-Nassr, but the Saudi outfit are now poised to sign Aymeric Laporte
newsArray.content: Eric Bailly has been left in limbo following reports that Manchester City have accepted a bid from Al-Nassr for Aymeric Laporte. Bailly, 29, is surplus to requirements at Manchester United and spent the whole of the 2022/23 campaign on loan in France with Marseille, but he failed to do enough to persuade the Ligue 1 outfit to make the move permanent. The Ivory Coast international is free to leave Old Trafford for good this summer and was seemingly lined up to be the next high-profile star to join the Saudi Pro League - but that move has now been scuppered by Al-Nassr's interest in Laporte. Man Utd transfer news LIVE: Maguire deal collapses, Amrabat bid 'imminent', Glazers set to sell Gary Neville makes fresh Man Utd transfer demand after Sofyan Amrabat endorsement According to The Athletic, the Saudi outfit have had a bid accepted for the 29-year-old centre-back, who featured just 12 times for the champions last season. Furthermore, Laporte is believed to be open to the idea of moving to the Middle East, indicating that a deal is viable. Al-Nassr's move for Laporte is likely to have significant ramifications for Bailly, who had been touted as a potential signing for the club who acquired Cristiano Ronaldo back in December. Sky Sports have since claimed that the defender will now consider his options after declining the opportunity to discuss a move to Besiktas, who had shown an interest in acquiring him. Join the debate! Where do you think Bailly will be playing next season? Let us know here. Bailly spent last season on loan at Marseille and is surplus to requirements at Old Trafford ( Image: Jonathan Moscrop/Getty Images) The defender was not a part of the Manchester United squad which travelled to the United States on their pre-season tour after his season-long stint at Marseille was wrecked by injuries. Bailly managed just 17 appearances for the French giants and struggled to show the sort of form which convinced United to shell out a whopping £30million for his services back in 2016 during the early days of Jose Mourinho's Old Trafford reign. Bailly's current plight was met with sympathy by his old international manager, Patrick Beaumelle - but the former Ivory Coast boss admitted that the defender's career was effectively in tatters. The collar also features a dash of both red and white, giving it a slick and modernised look. Prices start from £55 Kitbag Buy it now "It's a mess. He remains and will remain one of the best defenders I have known," Beaumelle told Africa Foot United last season. "It's a shame because a 100 per cent Bailly could have helped the team to grab points to be second. "He has not always been 100 per cent, it is perhaps the fault of bad luck when he loved Marseille and would have appreciated being part of this project." Join our new WhatsApp community! newsArray.title: Après Leandro Paredes, Renato Sanches (PSG) rejoint officiellement l'AS Rome
creator: Julien Baudot
newsArray.description: Quelques minutes après l'officialisation du transfert de Leandro Paredes du PSG à l'AS Rome, le club italien a annoncé, ce mercredi, l'arrivée du milieu portugais Renato Sanches, dans le cadre d'un prêt avec option d'achat obligatoire de 15 M€ en fonction du nombre de matches joués.
newsArray.content: , l'AS Rome a officialisé, ce mercredi, le transfert d'un autre milieu international en provenance du PSG, Renato Sanches. Le Portugais n'entrait plus dans les plans de l'entraîneur espagnol Luis Enrique. Selon nos informations, l'ex-Lillois arrive dans la capitale italienne dans le cadre d'un prêt avec option d'achat obligatoire de 15 M€ en fonction d'un certain nombre de matches joués. Surpuissant et capable de casser plusieurs lignes de pression par la passe et le dribble, Renato Sanches n'aura jamais réussi à s'imposer dans l'effectif parisien, en raison de ses blessures musculaires à répétition. Sous les ordres de José Mourinho, son compatriote, l'ex-Bavarois pourrait retrouver de la continuité, lui qui a réalisé une saison 2020-2021 excellente.
